text: Andrei Aleksandrovich Zavyalov (; , Andriy Oleksandrovych Zavyalov; born 2 January 1971 in Bila Tserkva) is a Ukraine-born Turkmenistani football coach and former player. ==Honours== ;Dynamo Kyiv *Ukrainian Premier League champion: 1992–93, 1993–94 *Ukrainian Cup winner: 1992–93 ==International== He represented Turkmenistan national football team at the 1998 Asian Games. ==References== Category:1971 births Category:People from Bila Tserkva Category:Living people Category:Soviet footballers Category:FC Ros Bila Tserkva players Category:Turkmenistan footballers Category:FC Dynamo Kyiv players Category:Turkmenistan expatriate footballers Category:Turkmenistan expatriate sportspeople in Ukraine Category:Ukrainian Premier League players Category:FC Dynamo-2 Kyiv players Category:FC Nyva Vinnytsia players Category:FC KAMAZ Naberezhnye Chelny players Category:Expatriate footballers in Russia Category:Russian Premier League players Category:FC Spartak Ivano- Frankivsk players Category:Turkmenistan international footballers Category:FC Metalurh Donetsk players Category:FC Oleksandriya players Category:FC Kryvbas Kryvyi Rih players Category:Hapoel Rishon LeZion F.C. players Category:Expatriate footballers in Israel Category:FC Hoverla Uzhhorod players Category:FC CSKA Kyiv players Category:FC Kyzylzhar players Category:Expatriate footballers in Kazakhstan Category:FC Stal Kamianske players Category:Turkmenistan football managers Category:Turkmenistan expatriate football managers Category:Expatriate football managers in Ukraine Category:Turkmenistan people of Ukrainian descent Category:Footballers at the 1998 Asian Games Category:FC Poltava managers Category:FC Karlivka managers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Turkmenistan expatriate sportspeople in Russia Category:Turkmenistan expatriate sportspeople in Israel Category:Turkmenistan expatriate sportspeople in Kazakhstan Category:Asian Games competitors for Turkmenistan
title: Andrei Zavyalov
